Definition: A finding based on laboratory test results that indicate an abnormally high level of bilirubin in the blood. Excess bilirubin is associated with jaundice.
A finding based on laboratory test results that indicate an decrease in number of white blood cells in a blood specimen.

A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate an elevation in the concentration of potassium in the blood; associated with kidney failure or sometimes with the use of diuretic drugs.

A disorder characterized by a reduction in the amount of hemoglobin in 100 ml of blood. Signs and symptoms of anemia may include pallor of the skin and mucous membranes, shortness of breath, palpitations of the heart, soft systolic murmurs, lethargy, and fatigability.
A disorder characterized by elevation of the body's temperature above the upper limit of normal.
A finding based on laboratory test results that indicate an increase in the level of alanine aminotransferase (ALT or SGPT) in the blood specimen.
A finding based on laboratory test results that indicate an increase in the level of aspartate aminotransferase (AST or SGOT) in a blood specimen.
A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate a low concentration of sodium in the blood.
A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate an elevation in the concentration of sodium in the blood.
A finding based on laboratory test results that indicate a decrease in number of platelets in a blood specimen.
A finding of a cardiac dysrhythmia characterized by an abnormally long corrected QT interval.
A disorder characterized by inflammation, swelling and redness to the conjunctiva of the eye.
Grade 3:
Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to
20/200); limiting self care ADL
Grade 4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation involving the spinal cord. Symptoms include weakness, paresthesia, sensory loss, marked discomfort and incontinence.
Grade 3: Severe weakness or sensory loss; limiting self care ADL

Definition: A finding of leakage of urine due to breakdown of a kidney anastomosis (surgical connection of two separate anatomic structures).
Grade 4:
Life-threatening consequences; urgent operative intervention
indicated

Definition: A disorder characterized by swelling due to an accumulation of excessive fluid in the neck.
Grade 3:
Severe or medically significant but not immediately life- threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; IV
intervention indicated

Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the chest unrelated to a heart disorder.
Grade 3:
Severe pain; limiting self care
ADL

Definition: A disorder characterized by the sensation of marked discomfort, distress or agony.
Grade 3:
Severe pain; limiting self care
ADL

Definition: A disorder characterized by marked discomfort sensation originating from a muscle or group of muscles.
Grade 3:
Severe pain; limiting self care
ADL

Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation involving the skeletal muscles.
Grade 3:
Pain associated with severe
weakness; limiting self care ADL
